@dafrista Great point. Does a `ConnectionFactory` instance have a unique end point id? Or can multiple `ConnectionFactory` instances share an end point id? I was assuming the former.

This pull request looks good

@bgchun I made each `ConnectionFactory` instance have a unique end point id :) . I added more comments to explain those things.

@dafrista for your last comment. As you pointed out, some end point id should be removed if there is a naming conflict. How about 1) document that please be careful to avoid naming conflict or 2) register local end point id to `NameServer` following the form _connectionFactoryId:endPointId_. With 2), many services can register same ids without any conflicts since connectionFactoryId must be different.

This pull request looks good

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #353](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/353/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

By the way, I don't understand why it used `SingleThreadStage` to register/unregister identifier(it is from existing `NetworkService`). Users does not know whether registering/unregistering is success or not. Moreover, `SingleThreadStage` does not execute pending tasks if it is closed. We can not guarantee all endPointIds are unregistered when `NetworkConnectionService` is closed.

How about making `registerConnectionFactory` and `unregisterConnectionFactory` throw `NetworkException` if it fails to register/unregister identifier? It is possible by directly calling `NameResolver`'s method which work synchronously.

@markusweimer Yes, please have a look. Thanks!
Looks good.  I will test (and merge).
@afchung This probably needs to change now that #381 is in, right?
@markusweimer Only the .NET side to enable restarts. Will be merging the change in. Thanks!
@markusweimer Done!
If these are examples, why not put them into the examples project? It might be a minor win, but it would make the IMRU DLL smaller.

@afchung I have trouble understanding the whole scope of this PR. There seem to be several things merged into one:
1. The way we represent the restart information is changed.
2. The state machine during restart is changed.
3. The timeout is introduced.

Those three seem somewhat independent functional changes. Are there more? Is it possible to separate them out or do they have to go in all at once?

I like the idea of (2). It uses the connectionFactoryId as a namespace. This will allow, for example, multiple services to use their contextIds as endPoints without causing trouble. But, we don't currently have a way to compose/append Identifiers. Would it be safe to append these identifiers' string representations?

@bgchun do you have a preference between (1) and (2), and the use of appended strings for (2)?

@gwsshs22 @dafrista We're rethinking muxing/demuxing at the edge. :) 
We're having discussion on removing `source` and `sink` in `RemoteEvent`. The main purpose of the fields were distinguishing across different endpoints. :) I will talk to you guys.
I've pushed a commit with (2). Thanks. @dafrista @bgchun

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #277](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/277/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

I've made a pass. While not part of your changes, the use of the concurrent map within `NetworkConnectionFactory.newConnection` looks wrong. Basically, the code doesn't guarantee that the same NetworkConnection between src and dst will be returned for each (concurrent) caller. We should add a new JIRA after this to clean it up.

The deprecation took some work, but it looks fine for now. I'll merge.
Yikes. I merged but mixed up the PR number and JIRA number :( It seems we can't rewind Apache's git, so @gwsshs22 will have to close this.
Merged in 7241317b5b12da7e8a087febcc3ad8b72c6987da.
Oh, I see. I will close the PR :)
@jwang98052 I've done a pass. I have some broader concerns I'll put onto the JIRA.
